last week, the Angiolini inquiry report into the circumstances that led to the murder of Sarah Everard,  was published, concluding that Wayne Couzens should never have been a police officer, as her family insisted that Sarah died because he was a police officer, she would never have got into a car of a stranger.⁠ now, the new documentary of bbc Sarah Everard: the search for justice, made in close collaboration with the Everard family, delves deeper into investigating her murder by the metropolitan police, looking at how this devastating crime unfolded and the impact that was felt across the country.⁠ Amy Beecham, writes how the documentary, is a harrowing but important reflection on the extent of violence_against_women and girls in our society.

one the largest conservative_party donors, Frank Hester made racist, violent and misogynistic comments about labour, member of parliament Dianne Abbot in 2019.
one the largest conservative_party donors, Frank Hester made racist, violent and misogynistic comments about labour, member of parliament Dianne Abbot in 2019.
while Hester claims they were rude, he completely failed to acknowledge the extreme, hateful misogynoir in these remarks.
misogynoir is a term coined by the queer black feminist Moya Bailey in 2010, referring to a specific form of sexism, rooted in racism.
the concept was also notably introduced by Sojourner Truth, who spoke out about misogynoir before the term was coined in her aint I a woman speech at the womens convention in 1851.
There are plenty of ways that misogynoir manifests in real life and sadly, these absolutely vile and shameful comments from conservative_party donor Frank Hester are an example of exactly that.

content warning.⁠ a metropolitan police officer has admitted to being a serial rapist who carried out more than 40 attacks against 12 women over the course of a 17 year period.⁠ David Carrick, 48, pleaded guilty at southwark crown court on monday to four counts of rape, false imprisonment and indecent assault relating to a 40 year old woman in 2003.

it can now be reported that he had already pleaded guilty to a further 43 charges, including 20 counts of rape, in december.⁠ the scale of the offences committed by Carrick, who carried out many of his attacks during his time with the metropolitan police, makes him one of the worst sexual offenders in modern criminal history.

spain has become the first european country to offer paid menstrual leave, in a progressive move by the government to guarantee better menstrual health.⁠ in a statement on thursday, the spanish congress said the new bill creates the possibility for women to call in sick  in case of incapacitating menstruation.⁠ according to politico, it was adopted by 185 votes against 154, with three abstentions.

spain has become the first european country to offer paid menstrual leave, in a progressive move by the government to guarantee better menstrual health.⁠ in a statement on thursday, the spanish congress said the new bill creates the possibility for women to call in sick  in case of incapacitating menstruation.⁠ according to politico, it was adopted by 185 votes against 154, with three abstentions.

the conservative popular party and far right vox voted against the measure.⁠ on the same day, spanish congress also gave final approval to laws which expanded abortion and transgender rights for teenagers.

Artemisia Gentileschi is one of the most celebrated female painter of the 17th_century and she was something so rare that it seems impossible: a 17th_century female artist who was able to use her art fight back against the male_violence that dominated the world she lived in.

Her rapist was set free, not because he was proven innocent but because he was protected by the pope.and so she painted her pain and painted her imagined revenge in the form of Judith Slaying Holofernes a tale from the old testamen.
while her male contemporaries were painting adoring Madonna or a naked nymphs, her painting and her skill you can really feel.i could have looked at it all day.

did you know that on any given day in 2021, there were 132,000 individuals living in modern slavery in the united arab emirates?

the exhibition provides a platform for important stories to be heard, featuring real testimonies from nigerian, ghanaian and kenyan women who were misled with the promise of well paid jobs in dubai, and instead forced into sex work.

their passports are often confiscated by their traffickers, and the women are told that to regain their travel documents and their freedom, they must pay their employer huge sums.the exhibition is organised by send them home, a campaign group helping to repatriate nigerian women trafficked to the united arab emirates, working with the nigerian national agency for the prohibition of trafficking in persons and hope education project, a pilot education programme in ghana tackling human trafficking at its source.
